abstract.text: Arrange views inside built-in layout containers like stacks and grids.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use layout containers to arrange the elements of your user interface.
Stacks and grids update and adjust the positions of the subviews they
contain in response to changes in content or interface dimensions.
You can nest layout containers inside other layout containers to any depth
To finetune the position, alignment, and other elements of a layout that you
build with layout container views, see

SwiftUI-PageImage-card.png.alt: A black Swift logo on a swirly blue and purple background.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
Compose a background behind your view and extend it beyond the safe area insets.

doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/Sw.title: Adding a background to your view

abstract.text: Compose complex layouts from primitive container views.
The placement of a container background.
Display large numbers of repeated views efficiently with scroll views, stack
views, and lazy stacks.
Place views in custom arrangements and create animated transitions between layout types.
A visual element that can be used to separate other content.
The material underneath the current view.
A container view that arranges other views in a two dimensional layout.
A description of a row or a column in a lazy grid.
A horizontal row in a two dimensional grid container.
Split content into logical sections inside lazy stack views.

doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/Sw.title: Grouping data with lazy stack views

abstract.text: A view that arranges its subviews in a horizontal line.
Make fine adjustments to alignment, spacing, padding, and other layout parameters.
A container view that arranges its child views in a grid that
grows horizontally, creating items only as needed.
A view that arranges its children in a line that grows horizontally,
creating items only as needed.
A container view that arranges its child views in a grid that
grows vertically, creating items only as needed.
A view that arranges its children in a line that grows vertically,
creating items only as needed.
Display a structured, scrollable column of information.
Build flexible user interfaces by using stacks, grids, lists, and forms.

doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/Sw.title: Picking container views for your content

abstract.text: A set of view types that may be pinned to the bounds of a scroll view.
Enable people to scroll to content that doesn’t fit in the current display.
A flexible space that expands along the major axis of its containing stack
layout, or on both axes if not contained in a stack.
Display selectable, sortable data arranged in rows and columns.
A view that arranges its subviews in a vertical line.
Present views in different kinds of purpose-driven containers, like forms or
control groups.
Sets the view’s background to a style.
Sets the view’s background to an insettable shape filled with a style.
Layers the views that you specify behind this view.
Sets the view’s background to the default background style.
Sets the view’s background to an insettable shape filled with the
default background style.
Sets the container background of the enclosing container using a view.
Sets the container background of the enclosing container using a view.
Specifies a custom alignment anchor for a view that acts as a grid cell.
Tells a view that acts as a cell in a grid to span the specified
number of columns.
Asks grid layouts not to offer the view extra size in the specified
axes.
Overrides the default horizontal alignment of the grid column that
the view appears in.
Layers the specified style in front of this view.
Layers a shape that you specify in front of this view.
Layers the views that you specify in front of this view.
Controls the display order of overlapping views.
A view that adapts to the available space by providing the first
child view that fits.
A view that overlays its subviews, aligning them in both axes.
A consistent layout that adapts to various contexts makes your experience more approachable and helps people enjoy their favorite apps and games on all their devices.
